titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Eleanor Houston Smith papers (series 73) 1918-1987
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Eleanor Houston Smith papers (series 73)

bioghist.p: Eleanor Houston Smith (1910-1987) was the daughter of Samuel Frederic Houston and the wife of Lawrence M.C. Smith. She was a Distinguished Daughter of Pennsylvania, served two terms on the Historical Commission of Pennsylvania, founder of the Schuylkill Valley Nature Center, and a longtime member of the Board of Governors of the Nature Conservancy. In 1987 she received the degree of Doctor of Humane Letters from the Philadelphia College of Textiles and Science.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Eleanor Houston Smith. Materials include: correspondence with family and friends; greeting cards; letters of condolence on the death of her husband Lawrence M. C. Smith; Christmas lists; genealogies; invitations; calendars and address books; diaries; scrapbooks; and photographs. Materials in the collection documenting financial matters include bills and receipts, wills, financial statements, account books, and inventories. The collection also contains materials related to the Franklin Broadcasting Company and WFLN. Records related to Smith's involvement with the Schuylkill Valley Nature Center include minutes, annual reports, correspondence and memos. In addition the collection contains correspondence, clippings, articles, reports, and brochures related to clubs and organizations in which Smith was a member or had an interest.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
